metadata.title: CVE-2022-1158 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in KVM. When updating a guest's page table entry, vm_pgoffwas improperly used as the offset to get the page's pfn. As vaddr andvm_pgoff are controllable by user-mode processes, this flaw allowsunprivileged local users on the host to write outside the userspace regionand potentially corrupt the kernel, resulting in a denial of servicecondition.
